info.title: Gateway API Specification
info.description: This is an API v1.1.0 specification for GET Cloud that allows devices to obtain existing information on GET Cloud and and submit data to GET Cloud.

200.description: Successfully returning the list of all available gateway versions.

get.summary: Get the latest gateway software version

200.description: Successfully returning the latest gateway software version.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: version is the gateway's version that is to be downloaded.

get.summary: Get the download path and hash

200.description: Successfully returning the detail of the requested gateway software version.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.description: Make an authenticated get request to this endpoint to signal that the device is up and running, without uploading any logs.
Make an authenticated get request to this endpoint to signal that the gateway is up and running.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.summary: Get indexes of existing history logs

200.description: Successfully getting the indexes of history log.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.summary: Get indexes of existing instant logs

200.description: Successfully getting the indexes of instant log.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.summary: Get indexes of existing event logs

200.description: Successfully getting the event of instant log.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

requestBody.description: The set of valid status fields depends on the type of device, as documented on the latestA00465document, or see the "Schema" section.

post.summary: Upload status logs for charger or BMU

200.description: Successfully uploading the status log of the selected device.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.summary: Get the last reported status for a certain device

200.description: Successfully showing the status of the given device visible for the logged in user.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

post.summary: Upload configuration for charger, BMU, or gateway

requestBody.description: The set of valid configuration fields depends on the type of device, as documented on the latestA00465document, or see the "Schema" section.

200.description: Successfully uploading the config log of the selected device.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.description: Get the latest configuration of a device

200.description: Successfully showing the configuration of the given device visible for the logged in user.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

requestBody.description: The set of valid configuration fields depends on the type of device, as documented on the latestA00465document, or see the "Schema" section.

post.summary: Upload history logs for charger or BMU

200.description: Successfully uploading the history logs of the selected device.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

requestBody.description: The structure of this endpoint always consists of an array of "events", each of which element consists of index, timestamp, type, and values. The structure of values depends on the event type. For instance, in the alarm event, each array element in values contains code and active. In the parameterChanged event, each array element in values contains index, oldValue, and newValue. See "schema" for more info.

post.summary: Upload status logs for charger or BMU

200.description: Successfully uploading the event log of the selected device.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

requestBody.description: The set of valid instant log fields depends on the type of device, as documented on the latestA00465document, or see the "Schema" section.

post.summary: Upload status logs for charger or BMU

200.description: Successfully uploading the instant log of the selected device.

serialNumber.description: Serial number of the device, 8 bytes. PU only use the 5 LSB. CCU only use the 4 LSB.

deviceTime.description: The current device time in POSIX format

cells.description: Number of cells of the battery

cycles2To25.description: Number of cycles where 25% or less of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged.

cycles26To50.description: Number of cycles where 26-50% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged.

cycles51To80.description: Number of cycles where 51-80% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged.

cycles81To90.description: Number of cycles where 81-90% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged.

cyclesAbove90.description: Number of cycles where more than 90% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged.

capacity.description: Capacity in Ah of the battery

totalChargeTime.description: Total time spent charging since reset of statistics.

totalChargeAh.description: Total number of Ah charged since reset of statistics.

historyLogCount.description: Number of History logs available in memory.

historyLogIndex.description: The index of the latest history log, logs are stored in a circular buffer. To read logs the index is needed.

historyLogDate.description: The timestamp of the last history log in POSIX format

eventLogCount.description: Number of Event logs available in memory.

eventLogIndex.description: The index of the latest event log, logs are stored in a circular buffer

totalAcPowerConsumption.description: Total number of Wh charged from mains supply since reset of statistics.

firmwareType.description: The firmware type number, what kind of firmware is on the device

firmwareVersion.description: The firmware version number, which version of the firmware type is on the device

eventType.description: The type of event, whether it's an alarm (0), startup (1), parameter changed (2), time set (3), calibration (4), cable Ri slope (5), generic (6), charge started (7), charge ended (8), mains state (9), network started (10), network joined (11), assert (12), and time not set (13)

time.description: The time when log was written

index.description: an incrementing counter that keeps track of the order of log entries, in case of incorrect timestamps

values.description: details about the event, see the Event types section below for details.

oneOf.description: Alarm event (type=0) which is generated when an alarm condition is detected as well as when a previously active alarm condition is resolved.

code.description: The code indicating the type of alarm

rawCode.description: the raw code indicating the type of the unknown alarm.

active.description: true when the alarm is triggered, false when a previously active alarm is resolved

oneOf.description: Startup event (type=1) which consist of a firmware object that specifies the device firmware's types and versions, the main firmware is specified in the main object and radio is specified in radio

type.description: The firmware type number, what kind of firmware is on the device

version.description: The firmware version number, which version of the firmware type is on the device

message.example: Unauthorized: You must log in to do this.
Must supply firmware with main version.

time.description: The time when log was written

index.description: Index of the instant log since start of operation

instantLogPeriod.description: The amount of seconds between instant logs, 0 = off
